page.title: 11LAW AND ORDER IN BLAYDON.
page.content: We went on a visit to the police station. There were lots of posters of people who were wanted for murder. The police station was opened in 1962. In May 1985 approximately 150-180 people arrested. There are about 110 people who work at the police station. The police do not often have trouble in Blaydon and Winlaton. The policemen think it is a good idea to wear a uniform. When you are a policeman you have to be 1m 70cm tall and a policewoman has to be 1m 60cm tall. A policeman works an eight hour day but often does overtime. A Blaydon solicitor with eleven years experience said that divorce cases made up 65% of her work. She specialised in matremonial law. She thought today's laws were more just than those in Norman times.
